communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The incident report and any supplements, such as police narratives,  the CAD log detailing the sequence of events, including all times and actions taken by dispatch and responding units during this incident, any police radio dispatch communications concerning the incident, including initial dispatch and subsequent communications related to the incident, a copy of any 911 calls, calls for service,  and any communications with other agency regarding a social media video recorded at the John Carrol School Campus this month. Please see the attached document for further information regarding this incident.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Daniel Boguslaw

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1) Financial records maintained by the College delineating total fees collected from students classified as “Lab Fees” for the following fiscal years: FY2022, FY2023, and FY2024. Please include a breakdown of lab fees by academic department/unit of the College.

2) Financial records maintained by the College outlining expenses paid by lab fees monies for the following fiscal years: FY2022, FY2023, and FY2024. Please include a breakdown of the expenses funded by "Lab Fees" monies by academic department/unit of the College.

3) Financial records maintained by the College delineating tuition dollars collected for the following fiscal years: FY2022, FY2023, and FY2024. Please breakdown the tuition by student’s declared degree program for the following programs: 
-Associate of Applied Science in Maritime Technology and Operations 
-Bachelor of Engineering in Electrical Engineering, Facilities Engineering, Marine Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Naval Architecture 
-Bachelor of Science in International Transportation and Trade, Marine Environmental Science, Maritime Studies, Marine Operations, Marine Transportation, Data Science and Machine Learning
-Master of Science in Shipping and Logistics, Maritime and Naval Studies 

4) For each record identified in the requests above, please provide an explanation of all abbreviations or acronyms in the records.

To the extent that records are available in electronic format ideally in either an electronic spreadsheet or comma-separated format (Excel or CSV). 

If any records are unavailable within five business days of receipt of the request, and responsive records exist, I seek a description of such records and a timeline of when access to the records will be provided. If you determine that certain parts of this request may be more easily produced than others, please provide records on a rolling basis.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

A. Eric Pasillas

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: David Lakeman letter to CCC
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide the letter that CCC Executive Director candidate David Lakeman sent to the commission turning down the job offer for ED.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Faraone

title: Department of Justice OIG - Cyber Attack Logs

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Department of Justice OIG - Cyber Attack Logs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Information Requested:

Please produce any and all records related to the DOJ OIG documenting 'attacks' on the DOJ OIG website assigning an 'Attack ID#'s and Message ID#' to each website attack. 

Include but do not limit this to any summaries, recommendations, findings,  provided to DOJ OIG management or referred to other DOJ entities for possible investigation or prosecution in relation to the tracking of threats related to these alleged 'attacks'.

The requester is completing an public investigation in corroborating to a statement provided by DOJ OIG Michael Horowitz in relation to issues attracting top cybertalent to the agency.  

Dates for search: 05/12/2023 - 10/12/2023

EFOIA Request

Fee waiver requested for broad public interest and newsmedia. 

Related:
https://potomacofficersclub.com/news/new-report-shows-doj-losing-cyber-talent-to-other-agencies/
https://oig.justice.gov/reports/department-justice-top-management-and-performance-challenges-2023/human-capital


William Fernandes

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

William Fernandes

title: FOIA Request for Case-Related Materials - Cecil Yahtin

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to public records under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). Specifically, I am requesting any and all records and materials related to the case of

Suspect Name: Cecil Yahtin
Description/Headline: Victim in Hazelwood Neighborhood Homicide Identified
Link of the Article: https: //www.portlandoregon.gov/police/news/read.cfm?id=533271
State: Portland OR
Law Enforcement: Portland Oregon Police (Det. Tony Harris)

included but not limited to the following:
Documents:
Incident reports
Investigation reports
Officer statements
Witness statements
Any other relevant case files

Footage:
Body camera footage from officers on the scene
Dash camera footage
Police surveillance camera footage
Private/public surveillance footage from nearby locations
Any footage collected as evidence or during the investigation

Audio:
911 calls
Police radio communications
Any other audio recordings related to the case
Visual Media:
Crime scene photographs
Surveillance stills
Photographs taken during the investigation

Court Records:
Transcripts from court hearings or proceedings
Any video/audio footage from court hearings
Court orders or any other court-related documents

Please include any and all materials, regardless of format (digital or physical), including those not listed above that are related to the case in question.
Additionally, if this request has been sent to the wrong department or agency, I would appreciate it if you could provide guidance or contact information for the correct department or agency that handles such requests.

If any part of the request is denied or redacted, please provide a detailed explanation of the specific legal exemption that applies.
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response within the period mandated by FOIA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

david yupa

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

david yupa

title: Reports regarding display of U.S. flag and recitation of Pledge of Allegiance

communications.subject: Oklahoma Open Records Act Request: Reports regarding display of U.S. flag and recitation of Pledge of Allegiance
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Each "report detailing [a district's] policies regarding the display of the U.S. flag and the weekly recitation of the Pledge of Allegiance," including the "specific measures the district has implemented to ensure compliance and how these practices are being integrated into the school culture," as required by the August 29, 2024, press release from Ryan Walter, State Superintendent of Public Instruction, concerning "Guidelines of Patriotic Displays."

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am looking for all records available in the shooting death of Halyna Hutchins on set of the film "Rust". Medical examiners report, autopsy, police reports - would be appreciated.

Thank you.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dawn Gandhi

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Lehman "Lee" Brightman
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents and files, including letters, memos, emails, and all communications that mention Cheyenne River Sioux activist Lehman "Lee" Brightman (born 1930 - died June 8, 2017). 

An obituary can be found at Lakota Country Times: https://www.lakotatimes.com/articles/lehman-l-brightman/. A PDF copy is attached.

I would also like to request a search of all available cross-index files for mentions of Lehman "Lee" Brightman in other documents, to be included with this request.

I request that fees be waived, as this information will be used for educational and journalistic purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nick Estes

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Agency Roster (East Lyme Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: 2024 Texas Body Camera Awards
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

On December 18, 2024 Governor Abbott announced that the Public Safety Office will administer over $500 million in grant funding for a variety of public safety programs and services in Texas, including 98 awards, totaling $4.6 million, to equip peace officers with body-worn camera systems.  Please provide a list of those agencies receiving body-worn camera awards, showing the amounts awarded to each agency (if available).  If a list of the awardees does not exist, please provide any documents, reports, data files, or communications that identify the body-worn camera award recipients.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Tepper

title: NCAA Athlete LIL Policies and payments

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: NCAA Athlete LIL Policies and payments
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The NCAA $2.7 billion settlement in October 2024, allows Division I schools to compensate athletes directly and provide new payments and benefits.  Virginia Code § 22.1-212.2:4. Interscholastic athletics; student-athletes; compensation and representation for name, image, or likeness allows student-athletes at public and private higher education institutions to receive compensation for the use of their NIL. 

This FOIA request records covering the development and approval of VMI policies governing such compensation that the institute is responsible for establishing policies to comply with state legislation and NCAA regulations, ensuring that athletes are informed and supported in regard to these opportunities as well as who approved these policies and proceedures and when if not shown on the records themselves. These shoudl include, without limitation, and communications, training or other information provided to eleigible NCAA athletes (former and current). Records requested also include those whowing the number of former athletes who graduated from VMI or departed VMI for any reason, including the Portal, that are eligible for compensation. 

If the required policies, processes, proceedures and other records are not yet developed by VMI place confirm that none exist and are in place now with records showing the proposed timeline for their development, approval, and implementation as well as the range of years the compensation will cover for NCAA athletes who are no longer cadets at VMI.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: NIL Clubs at VMI
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records for all Name Image and Likeness Clubs for NCAA teams and/or athletes at VMI to include, without limitation, Club Charters, operating proceedures, members, faculty or other advisors, financial records and all regulations, policies, Memorandums and proceedures that govern their creation, operation, membership, disbursement of funds, and other matters for the period August 1, 2022 - the date of this request. Records should also include any and all exemptions from VMI policies, regulations, memorandums or other governance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: Child care provider data (Child Care Licensing Bureau, Baton Rouge)

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Child care provider data (Child Care Licensing Bureau, Baton Rouge)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Historical data on all licensed child care providers (active and closed) from as far back as data systems will allow to present. I also request data on license-exempt providers, if available. Specifically, I request the following information as it is available:

1)	Provider name or ID
2)	Street number
3)	Street name
4)	City
5)	Zip code
6)	Licensed capacity for each year (by child age group if available)
7)	Enrollment for each year (by child age group if available)
8)	Provider type (e.g., center-based provider, home-based provider, Head Start, school-based pre-K, etc.) for each year
9)	First license issue (open) date
10)	Most recent license issue date
11)	Most recent license expiration date or close date
12)	Ages served for each year
13)	Hours of operation for each year
14)	QRIS rating for each year (please explain who is required to participate and whether there are financial supports based on rating)
15)	Accepts Child Care and Development Fund subsidies for each year
16)	Accepts other types of subsidies for each year (please list types)
17)	Prices for each year (by child age group if available)
18)	Violation records

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gabrielle Pepin

Historical data on all licensed child care providers (active and closed) from as far back as data systems will allow to present. I also request data on license-exempt providers, if available. Specifically, I request the following information as it is available:

1)	Provider name or ID
2)	Street number
3)	Street name
4)	City
5)	Zip code
6)	Licensed capacity for each year (by child age group if available)
7)	Enrollment for each year (by child age group if available)
8)	Provider type (e.g., center-based provider, home-based provider, Head Start, school-based pre-K, etc.) for each year
9)	First license issue (open) date
10)	Most recent license issue date
11)	Most recent license expiration date or close date
12)	Ages served for each year
13)	Hours of operation for each year
14)	QRIS rating for each year (please explain who is required to participate and whether there are financial supports based on rating)
15)	Accepts Child Care and Development Fund subsidies for each year
16)	Accepts other types of subsidies for each year (please list types)
17)	Prices for each year (by child age group if available)
18)	Violation records

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gabrielle Pepin

title: Request for records concerning Donald Trump and/or JD Vance

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Request for records concerning Donald Trump and/or JD Vance
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, etc.) created or written by Wisconsin State Assembly Speaker Robin Vos between July 21, 2024 and the date this request is processed which have not yet been released to the general public and which contain one or more of the following words, terms, or phrases (case-insensitive):

-"Donald"

-"Trump"

-"Vance"

-"Mar-a-Lago"

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Christopher Tidmarsh

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Agency Roster (Palm Springs Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.subject: Records Request Confirmation
communications.communication:
The City Clerk’s Office is in receipt of your Public Records Request.  Please note that the City of Palm Springs has up to ten (10) calendar days to respond to your request, or the next business day thereafter. If needed, an extension may be requested as the City works to compile all responsive records. Should our office need further clarification on your request, we will be in contact with you. 
  
 
Your request security key is A90EE409.
Your request reference number is Request Number: PD-12-2025.

Please have this security key and reference number available when communicating with our staff regarding your request.

files.title: attachment-1
files.source: Palm Springs Police Department, Palm Springs, CA

title: Department of Defense support for 2008 documentary "Full Battle Rattle"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Department of Defense support for 2008 documentary "Full Battle Rattle"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to collaboration between the Department of Defense (DoD) and the production of the 2008 documentary movie "Full Battle Rattle," directed by Jesse Moss and Tony Gerber. The documentary was filmed in a US Army installation in the Mojave Desert, used for conducting war simulations of the Iraq theater. I request any and all documents pertaining to DoD involvement with the production of "Full Battle Rattle." Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of DoD and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Full Battle Rattle," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records of the number of State Cadets by class, by gender, by race/ethnic background as defined in § 23.1-2506 enrolled in VMI, number graduated, the financial assistance provided, and in what capacity they served their two year obligation after graduation for the past 10 academic years including those currently enrolled in academic year 2024 – 2025. If there were no State cadets in the past 10 years or are currently enrolled, please provide this information for the last 3 years any State Cadets were enrolled at VMI. If this program is no longer active at VMI provide the last year VMI enrolled a State cadet and the records showing why the program stopped, who approved its termination, when, and for what reason including any decision documents, recommendations, etc. Any personally identifying information (PII) or FERPA information identifying the individual can be redacted.

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Uniforms/UMS Activity Fees
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records  showing what specifically is included in the “Uniforms / UMA Activities  fee” as well as the financial records showing ledger level itemized income and expenditures for Uniforms / UMA Activities  fees for the 2020 – 2021, 2021 – 2022, 2022 – 2023, 2023 – 2024 and 2024 – 2025 academic years including how this fee per cadet was determine, who approved the fee, all income to this fund by source, and all expenditures for these funds to the line-item level. For 2024 – 2025 include what is programmed, allocated and committed to date. These should include the portion of these fees allocated for uniforms and UMA Activities to include, without limitation, a definition of each “UMA Activity”. Itemized expenditures for uniforms and UMA Activities should total the amount reported as collected from Cadets and other identified sources. Itemized expenditures are requested for the amount allocated and line-item expenditures to each areas and what was budgeted for each for the selected academic years what will enable analysis of allocated to expended and within expenditures identify what products or services were procured. This information should be readily available in any reasonable standard accounting system using acceptable accounting practices and so should not require a significant level of efforts to identify and provide those records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Cadet Activity Fees
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records  showing what specifically is included in the “Cadet Facilities/Activity” as well as the financial records showing ledger itemized income and expenditures for Cadet Facilities/Activity fees for the 2008 – 2009, 2009 – 2010, 2020 – 2021, 2021 – 2022, 2022 – 2023, 2023 – 2024 and 2024 – 2025 academic years including how this fee per cadet was determine, who approved the fee, all income to this fund by source, and all expenditures for these funds to the line-item level by student or other activity. For 2024 – 2025 include what is programmed, allocated and committed to date. Itemized expenditures are requested for the amount allocated and line-item expenditures to each club and student organization and what was budgeted for each for the selected academic years what will enable analysis of allocated to expended and within expenditures identify what products or services were procured. These should include the portion of these fees allocated for cadet facilities/activities consisting of facilities maintenance, debt service, cadet counseling services, cadet organizations and any other expenditures from this fund by office or organization that expended the funds, by supply or service purchased. For example, “Cadet Program Board” is described as “provides entertainment, relaxation and fun” so records should contain what specific entertainment, relaxation and fun” activities and other costs were paid out of the accounts. Itemized expenditures by category and organization should total the amount reported as collected from Cadets and other identified sources. This information should be readily available in any reasonable standard accounting system using acceptable accounting practices and so should not require a significant level of efforts to identify and provide those records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Prison OIG Reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am requesting records related to the OIG's audit of California's prison by the department's Field Investigations Monitoring Unit
I am requesting body cam footage, surveillance, and any recordings from notable dispositions from the following audits
- Use of Force case blocks report of cases closed in 2024 where the use of force was sustained, categorical, or deadly
- Use of Force 2023 audit where the use of force was out of policy, categorical, deadly, or used impermissible stranglehold

Thank you!

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Sanchez-Castro ICE Death Docs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records pertaining to the death in custody of Jose Manuel Sanchez Castro on October 27, 2024. See https://www.ice.gov/doclib/foia/reports/ddrJoseManuelSanchezCastro.pdf. 

Specifically, I request: 
1. The IHSC Mortality Review.
2. The ICE OPR ERAU Detainee Death Review Report.
3. The Healthcare and Security Compliance Analysis SME report. 
4. The Root Cause Analysis, if any.
5. The Corrective Action Plan created based on findings in records 1-4 above, if any. 
6. The Contract Discrepancy Report issued based on any findings in records 1-4 above, if any. 
7. Any cover letter, transmittal letter, or memorandum that accompanied records 1-6 above as these records were transmitted to ICE leadership. 

Requestor Information
I make this request as a member of the media engaged primarily in information dissemination and seek a fee waiver based on this designation. I am an independent journalist engaged in both self-published documentation of deaths in DHS custody (e.g., via the DetentionKills substack) and also in edited works appearing or under contract with outlets such as Prism, the Atlanta Community Press Collective. I was also a contributing author to the recent civil society report on deaths in ICE custody, available here: https://assets.aclu.org/live/uploads/2024/06/2024-07-01-ICE-Detainee-Deaths.pdf. 

Expedited Processing Request 
Pursuant to 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e), I request expedited processing and make the following statements under penalty of perjury pursuant to 28 USC 1746: 

1. Deaths in ICE custody increased 300% in FY24 after reaching a 40-year low in each of the two previous fiscal years.  
2. The GEO Group operates the Northwest ICE Processing Center, where Mr. Sanchez Castro was detained prior to his death. 
3. The GEO Group has previously been found by ICE to have failed to comply with contractually mandated standards in ways that contributed to the deaths of immigrants in ICE custody. 
4. ICE has previously assessed contractual penalties against GEO based on those findings. 
5. ICE falsely claims in the wake of deaths in custody that people received 24/7 emergency medical treatment; the agency's own Mortality Reviews frequently find such care was not provided, or was deficient and outside safe limits of practice. 
6. There is an urgent need to inform the public about the track record of ICE detention contractors as the agency considers awarding billions of dollars in new contracts to detain human beings. 
7. Deaths in ICE custody have been the subject of widespread media attention raising serious questions of government wrongdoing. 
8. ICE ceased releasing Detainee Death Review Reports affirmatively following the death of Roger Rayson in GEO's care in 2017, forcing the public to obtain these records via FOIA. 
9. ICE is serially outside processing times required by FOIA, leading to multiple federal courts holding the agency has a pattern and practice of violating the law when it comes to untimely responses. 
10. Expedited processing of this request will allow the public to critically assess the performance of contractors who receive taxpayer funds, and to assess preventive measures that will avoid future in-custody deaths.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.communication:

Sincerely,

Patrick O'Doherty

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Florida enforcement of HB3
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of any complaint under Florida s. 501.1736, F.S., or otherwise referred to in the January 3, 2025, article published by USA Today (available at https://www.tallahassee.com/story/news/politics/2025/01/03/some-porn-sites-blocked-but-others-ignore-florida-age-verification-law/77401109007/ ("Chase Sizemore, spokesperson for Florida Attorney Ashley Moody, said in a Thursday afternoon email that Moody's office had received three complaints so far 'regarding pornographic websites failing to comply with age verification laws.' 'These complaints are currently under active review by our Enforcement Division,' Sizemore said. The office is responsible for enforcing the law.")).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh
